Name: Stela of Isy
Description: The lunette contains six carved horizontal lines of text containing a regnal year and the offering formula. In the register underneath, the owner of the stela is depicted sitting on a chair. In front of him is a low offering table and an offering-bearer. Facing him, on the far right, his wife is sitting in front of another offering table. The second register depicts five standing figures in front of a woman sitting on the ground, all with captions. At the bottom of the stela is an inscription mentioning other relatives. On the left are two standing men with captions. The stela has no frame.
